newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thai's Bangchak refinery cuts output.
newsitem.headline: Thai's Bangchak refinery cuts output.

text.p: Thailand's Bangchak Petroleum Co's 120,000 barrels-per-day (bpd) refinery cut production rates two weeks ago to 100,000 bpd, a refinery source said on Thursday.
The source also said the maintenance turnaround of its 40,000-bpd crude distillation unit (CDU) has been postponed from August to at least September or later.
The source said that weak refinery profit margins had prompted the cut in runs in order to improve the economics of refining oil.
He said the refinery was uncertain when it would return to full capacity, but it was looking for a rise in gas oil prices as the main factor that would indicate better margins.
